update.description:
Added the ability to load X2 with four sensor configurations:

1. 2D short range LIDAR \+ QVGA camera \+ IMU
2. 2D short range LIDAR \+ HD camera \+ IMU
3. 2D medium range LIDAR \+ QVGA camera \+ IMU
4. 2D medium range LIDAR \+ HD camera \+ IMU

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2675006934-x2_low.png)
![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/907108141-x2_med.png)
For now, the configuration is done via environment variables.

For testing, use `X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1`, `X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_2`, `X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_3` or `X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_4`. Here’s an example:

    roslaunch subt_gazebo competition.launch scenario:=tunnel_practice_2
    X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_3=1 roslaunch subt_example team.launch

‌

_~~Note: This pull request is built atop pull request #48, which should be merged first.~~_
update.title: Sensor configurations for X2

update.title: Sensor configurations for X2

content.raw:
I think the short range laser is not positioned correctly. Here is the output from the topic viewer when using `X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1=1 roslaunch subt_example team.launch`. It looks like the laser is positioned inside a collision element.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/1056802813-short_range_laser.png)
content.html: I think the short range laser is not positioned correctly. Here is the output from the topic viewer when using X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1=1 roslaunch subt_example team.launch. It looks like the laser is positioned inside a collision element.

content.raw: Maybe @nkoenig has more information about it, because all the specs I know about the cameras are their resolution.
content.html: Maybe @nkoenig has more information about it, because all the specs I know about the cameras are their resolution.

content.raw:
I’ve changed the tilt angle from 30 to 15 degrees and reduced the near clip distance. [e404efc](#!/osrf/subt/commits/e404efc83e55bb9ad1d1d8a5d252b35df7faef9e?at=default)

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/3611640345-x2_image.png)
content.html: I’ve changed the tilt angle from 30 to 15 degrees and reduced the near clip distance. e404efc

update.title: Sensor configurations for X2

content.raw: I also noticed that the camera images are rgb here but the ones on the drones are grayscale. I don’t know if we want to keep them consistent
content.html: I also noticed that the camera images are rgb here but the ones on the drones are grayscale. I don’t know if we want to keep them consistent

content.raw:
![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2466133158-x2_cam.png)
‌

This is the image output from the camera sensor. Should we tilt it up a bit or is this on purpose?

The bottom part is of the view clipped and hence we see through the ground. If we’re keeping this camera angle then we should reduce the camera near clip distance.
content.html:
‌

This is the image output from the camera sensor. Should we tilt it up a bit or is this on purpose?

The bottom part is of the view clipped and hence we see through the ground. If we’re keeping this camera angle then we should reduce the camera near clip distance.
